cards.back: Data that provides information about other data.
A variable that stores the memory address of another variable.
A programming technique where a function calls itself to solve a problem.
A data structure that follows the FIFO (First-In-First-Out) principle.
A data structure that follows the LIFO (Last-In-First-Out) principle.
Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol - the suite of communication protocols used for the internet.
eXtensible Markup Language - a markup language that defines rules for encoding documents.
A way of describing the efficiency of an algorithm in terms of the input size.
